Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet rooms and staff are super friendly & helpful”
Reviews.Author: steph000084
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Memphis only 2 nights but I was really pleased with the choice we made to stay here. Our room had 2 big double beds, the tv had loads of channels, the air con was a welcome relief from the warmth outside (a little noisy but nothing to complain abt), the bathroom was spotless & there were plenty of towels & toiletries provided to us. The free breakfast was lovely & the staff were typical happy welcoming southerners. The pool looked lovely tho we didn't make it for a swim, and there were plenty of vending machines for snacks. Great location, only a cpl blocks from Beale Street but far enough not to have noise or traffic dramas. Def recommend!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Value, Poor Service.”
Reviews.Author: Chris P
Reviews.Content: Econo Lodge is situated close to Beale street and the walk is safe. We didn't like outdoor accessible lifts to all floors with rooms, which essentially means a crazy man not in the hotel could potentially come knocking on your door at all hours. Value for money was OK however sheets had multiple stains and we had an ant infestation on and below our sink. Picture attached shows a cup by the sink. I finished it went for a shower and 15 minutes later this was the result. I would say if you want a close place to Beale street then this place isn't bad and is probably better priced than most others in Memphis however don't expect any decent service. I would have been impressed if the bloke behind the desk new what planet we were on never mind what hotel we were in. Overall rating - Average but worth it for location.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: cmhill1785
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed at I don't have to stay at a place with 5 stars or mints on the pillow but dam the bed was hard as a rock every bone in my body hurt only had four hours of sleep because of that dam bed the shower didn't work I had to take a tub bath called to see how the shower worked they didn't know didn't try to help at all we was going to stay two nights but only stayed for one got our money back if you going to stay in Memphis please spend a bit more and go somewhere eles because I wish I would have

Reviews.Title: “Good location, large room”
Reviews.Author: stephandjack
Reviews.Content: We only had time for one night in Memphis and this was the best deal we could find. If you book on the choicehotels.com web site, you can use a senior or AAA discount. The hotel is located on top of a parking ramp and the check in office is located at the entrance to the parking ramp. We found the office staff friendly and helpful. Our room on the 8th floor looked out on the (unheated) pool and patio, tho there is no patio entrance from the room. The room was quite large and the furnishings were fine, tho a bit dated. The room was clean. Wifi was free. We didn't try the breakfast provided, just had the in-room coffee. The toilet needed to be jiggled to stop it running, and I forgot to report that to management. We were charged $10 for parking. Everything is a bit old, but for the price and location I don't think you can beat it. We walked to restaurants in the Beale Street area, to the Memphis Redskins stadium and to the Peabody Hotel. The area right around the hotel has quite a few closed buildings and a few panhandlers, but nothing awful.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest experience but location is excellent”
Reviews.Author: Laurajoshb
Reviews.Content: My Econo Lodge experience started out poorly from the beginning of the transaction - although it was booked through a hotel booking website. We asked for a room within a budget ($60) & were offered Econo Lodge, we were charged $19 tax on top of our budget but we understood we had free parking so decided to take the option (ended up paying $79) Upon arrival, the receptionist could not be described as friendly or helpful - informative only within the boundaries of the check in process. She even answered us back under her breath when we enquired about the noise in the street. We then were informed that there was an additional fee to park the car. We explained that we understood that there wasn't a parking fee but met a surly response. So our budget had blown out from $60 to $90. The room was large, well kept & comfortable, functional. The wifi is free although signal was weak at times. There is an elevator between levels. A simple breakfast is provided - bagel coffee, juice. In terms of location - it is excellent, walking distance to Beale St. Not my finest hotel stay but not an entirely dodgy experience. Recommended for the budget conscious traveller.

Reviews.Title: “If you can avoid it, do.”
Reviews.Author: blackgreen
Reviews.Content: Our trip was fairly unplanned and we left ourselves with not much choice of where to stay in Memphis without forking out a fortune. It didn't get off to a good start when checking in. The girl behind the desk who seemed new to the job turned downright hostile as she struggled with the check-in system. Fortunately, she was quickly joined by a much more pleasant gentleman who sorted things out, The room was itself was rundown and unpleasant. The only real plus I can give it is location. It's very handy for Beale St and quite good for the National Civil Rights Museum. Also, rather than Breakfast there, try Cockadoos nearby. A really nice breakfast at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not the place to stay for a night of comfort. Parking garage has abandoned cars(making you sense there is a safety issue), hotel room had mildew on the ceiling, bedspread had burned cigarette marks, towels were falling apart and shower/in room telephone did not work. Would not recommend if you want to rest easy at night.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap place downtown”
Reviews.Author: abnormal456
Reviews.Content: I was on a cross country road trip and this was the perfect place to stop to see memphis for the night. The King room was impeccably clean and spacious. The front desk staff was very helpful in directing me towards things to do in Memphis. Yes the walls are thin, yes the building is kind of sketchy looking, but you can't beat the location for the money.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: Blair M
Reviews.Content: This hotelâ€™s first 3 or 4 floors are a car parking garage with the rooms being on the top three floors. The rooms are large and comfortable. The hotel is within walking distance of Beale St (although I wouldnâ€™t recommend walking around from the hotel at night), the Peabody Centre and Mud Island. The complimentary breakfast is served downstairs in the bar. The selection is sparse with bagels or muffins to eat and coffee and orange juice to drink. Great BBQ downstairs. **Visited March 2010**

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: Itzapa-Itzapa
Reviews.Content: Weren't sure what to expect and thought it could be poor but pleased to say it was pretty good for a city centre hotel with friendly easy going staff. Beds were very comfortable. Breakfast a bit plain but it is a budget hotel

Reviews.Title: “Old but clean, friendly staff and 4 blocks from Beale St.”
Reviews.Author: beeg0518
Reviews.Content: Ok after reading the reviews I was a little skeptical however this really fit my budget so I booked it. I was picking my husband up there because he works on the Mississippi. He had been gone for 45 days I wanted it to be a nice night. Upon check in while talking to the clerk about why I was there she printed me directions to pick up my husband without me asking. Got to the room which is better than most Econo Lodges it wasn't finished being made up. The housekeeper apologized brought me a just laundered spread and asked if needed anything. So if you're expecting The Peabody you should probably book there! Keep up the good work Econo Lodge we will be visiting pretty frequently! Thank Again!

Reviews.Title: “Econolodge Memphis: yuck!”
Reviews.Author: Tina-Marie1962
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our first road trip, and Memphis was on the way back to Missouri. We chose this hotel based on the proximity to Beale St. The neighborhood is a bunch of closed down and boarded up buildings, and the area around the hotel is very scummy looking and scary. Regardless of the fact that Beale was 4/10's of a mile, Don't stay here!!!. The rooms are yucky, the toilet seat was broken and just laying on top of the toilet, the bathroom floor was sticky with some kind of film. We are not room snobs, as we travel quite frequently and have stayed everywhere. I did not realize what a dump Memphis is outside of the 2 block radius around the Jazz area. If you are traveling and need a laundromat: don't use the two that are showing up on Garmon. They are in burned out scary areas with high crime. Here is a better idea: Spend the money and stay at either the Marriott, the Hampton or the Hilton off Beale. You will feel much safer.

Reviews.Title: “Major concerns”
Reviews.Author: KathyJx
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I am on a business trip, so although this hotel is located only a few blocks from Beale street, I am NOT here to party. I am actually working. So when some drunk tried to come in my room as I was getting ready for work, I did not appreciate it. I called security after I asked the guy to leave and he tried to tear my door off the hinges. Security informed me that this is a common problem here, because of the location to Beale. People get drunk, come back and can not remember their room number. Other than that the hotel is fairly clean and I could tell my room was scrubbed good before I came in. I could even smell Comet in the tub, which made me feel a little better about the shady parking garage I had to park in. I would say if you are a female and you are staying alone, pay extra to stay at one of the nicer hotels. It will make you feel more secure, trust me. However, if you are traveling on a budget, this place is clean, roomy and close to everything. Oh, on a brighter note they do have Wi Fi.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother waking up for breakfast, but can't beat location and price.”
Reviews.Author: StiffNeckPauper
Reviews.Content: The front desk employees were very pleasant and nice. And the location was fantastic! A short walk to everything worth seeing. The breakfast, however, ends really early - and it's great. Don't bother getting up for it. Also, our internet rarely worked, and the room definitely needs some updating.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good!”
Reviews.Author: Thedriver22
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed two nights and were pleased with the overall experience. It is an inexpensive hotel, and the room reflected that. It was small, but tidy. The beds were very comfortable. The staff was friendly. The hotel was within walking distance of lots of great things downtown and close to the interstate too. Keep your expectations in check and you won't be disappointed! I will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “forget this one”
Reviews.Author: stinchcombe99
Reviews.Content: very tatty, nil security, staff would rather talk between themselves than to customers, breakfast a waste of space. Pay a little more and stay elsewhere, plenty of hotels close to Beale street etc.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: 2sawn
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in late July. These were some of the muggiest days in Memphis this year. The a/c in the room functioned wonderfully. The biggest plus of this place it its location. It is a few blocks walk from Beale Street and the Peabody. After a late start, we left the hotel at 10:55 AM and still made it to the Peabody in time to watch the ducks march in. If you don't mind 15 people asking you to spare them some change on the walk back to the hotel at night from Beale Street (which is true in almost any American downtown area), this seems like the only "decent" chain hotel that is in the downtown area. It is half the price of all other options. Numerous great restaurants, bars and clubs are within walking distance. The staff at this hotel is just plain rude. There was no welcome when I checked in. There was no greeting as an Elite Diamond member. I usually am allowed to check out late, but they would only allow a 1 hour extension from 11 AM to noon. The front desk allowed me to extend my check out time until noon. However, the room attendant kept knocking on the door every hour starting at around 9 am asking if I was "going to check-out yet." Even when I went down the hallway just to get some ice, she still asked me the same question and "when exactly it would be." I kept telling her "soon." I got fed up and finally just checked out at 11 AM. I thought the breakfast was decent for an econo lodge. This is not a "your morning breakfast" like comfort inn makes with several hot items. If you want that you can stay at the award winning comfort inn a few blocks away for double the price. There were bagels and toaster ovens; danishes; real orange juice; coffee and sliced bread. I pretty much expect a bunch of carbohydrates in the morning if I stay at the "lesser" choice hotels like econo lodge and rodeway inn. Unlike some of the other econo lodge franchises, it was better than just having the selection of a stale muffin, coffee, and a cheaply made sunny delight rip off orange mix as a beverage. I agree with what another reviewer said about the elevators. ANyone off the street could just walk into them. They are outside, across from the front desk, but they don't always seem to be paying much attention. All around the world, I seem to have strange fascinations like elevator inspection code documents within the elevator. These elevators did not have any. One of them went from floor to floor but the numbers did not light up on the buttons themselves and on the numbers showing you where you were above the elevator door. Parking is $10 per night per vehicle. There are in and out privileges. It did seem like a safer place to park overnight than many of the other "open" lots nearby.On the other hand, this place is not the Ritz. They really should offer free parking to paying hotel customers. It would likely boost their ratings some. The pool is strictly locked up at 10 PM. You literally can not even go outside to walk anywhere in the courtyard after a staff member locks the door. There are visible staff members during the day, but not so many at night. Also, I did not notice any security guards any place on the property. The bathroom was the worst part about this hotel. The finish inside the tub was peeling off. We made a comment about this to the management, but it looked exactly the same on the second night. They really should make a better effort to try and make the bathrooms look more decent. There is a coffee maker in the room and their were coffee packets but no creamer or sugar packets (at least in our room there wasn't). I drank black coffee that morning and that evening, the room attendant did not even leave more coffee packets for the next day. We didn't complain about this, but the hotel staff is not exactly responsive to complaints (like that dreadful tub) so we did not bother. If you have to stay downtown for cheap and want to walk everywhere, this may be the best option. However, if $60-$80 is your budget and you don't mind paying for cabs, public transportation or parking to go to Beale Street, you are better off somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Consider other options...”
Reviews.Author: sirpres
Reviews.Content: It's built on up of a parking garage, if that tells you anything. We did our weekend getaway to Memphis on the cheap, but we won't stay here again. The "staff" is very uncaring, unfriendly and down right rude. Be advised... the elevator to the rooms is in the parking garage, next to the street. So, anyone off the street can hop in (you should be concerned about this when you read on). There was no security. The rooms were very old... done of the furnishings were up-to-date. Not very clean. Paper-thin walls. Loud air conditioner under the window. The only thing it has going for it is the location... it's within walking distance to Beale Street, the FedEx Forum and AutoZone Park. However, if you are walking back from one of these places to this hotel, make sure it's daylight and/or you're with a group. My wife and I were walking back from Beale Street after 10pm. No one was around, when suddenly we heard footsteps running up behind us. When we got to the next corner, police were directing cars out of the Peabody Hotel parking garage. We stayed on the corner while two young men appeared from behind us, walked across the street and disappeared down a dark alley behind the EconoLodge (remember what I said about the elevator? It was only a few feet away). We felt our Guardian Angels were with us I love Memphis, but we will spend more money and stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Was not bad for the low downtown price!”
Reviews.Author: CountryRoseUK
Reviews.Content: Hi there We stayed at this hotel in Mid June and were here for 4 night, the last of our nights in our 2.5 week holiday. We pre-booked this hotel online before we left for the US, as it was significantly cheaper than all others downtown. We did not go in the pool so cannot comment on this. There are a fair amount of 'cons' to this property: 1) The entrance/ car park/ lifts/ general area was pretty sketchy and run down. However in saying that it was the presentation of the property rather than anything or anyone behaving sketchy on the property itself. 2) The room, although it was pretty clean in the main, the blankets had smoking holes burned in 3) It is next to a derelict looking office block, and depending where your room is you can see straight in, and I suspect there are people living in that block, that's not really anything Econolodge can do about this! 4) The walls are a bit thin, but we were never woken up. You could hear people talking in their rooms tho as you walked down the corridor. 5) The breakfast room was not great - a bit depressing- and the selection was starch carbs only- pastry/cakes/ bagels. Coffee and OJ. I think this is the cheapest they can get away with. 6) Seems like flimsy complaint but there was a lack of TV channels, only a handful. Pros: Location Location Location! Price- Â£35 a night was perfectly acceptable for such a downtown location- especially on a weekend! Obvious security on the property, who quizzed us before we got into the lift to make sure we were staying here, they were visible in the early hours of the morning as we came back. A&R BBQ is attached on the ground floor and I had a most acceptable shoulder sandwich & Lemon Icebox pie there The rooms were really large so we slept away from the door. Vending Machines, & Ice machines,. stocked, worked, no problems. Staff helpful when we wanted to leave our bags on our check out day and go for Breakfast and so on, calling us a cab offering advice, etc. Having seen the back area \I would say the staff have to work in pretty run down environment themselves. I would say we didn't really have a lot of interaction with the staff there, once we were checked in we didn't see anyone till we checked out. Personally we prefer it that way, we didn't need help from them, but we would have asked if we did. Would stay again if we ever find ourselves in Memphis again.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: qmask
Reviews.Content: After being on the road for three weeks and really looking forward to being in Memphis we were really disappointed with this place. Where to begin? Surly front staff? Request for extra pillows denied? Stains in sink and tub? Paper thin towels? No hair dryer? Breakfast consisted of rock hard bagels and shared package of cream cheese..no decaf, no tea, no cereal. Go somewhere else! We checked out a day early!!!

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL FRONT STAFF EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: agr432
Reviews.Content: Do not even deal with these people! Made reservations months prior to the trip for the "Mempis in May" events. Everything was good to go until a week before. Had a group that booked 15 rooms. To make a complaint short... FRONT STAFF was sooooo unorganized!!! They over &/or double charged!! 5 different guest had to call there banks to clear it up, since all the staff wanted to do was say it wasn't their fault! Rooms were also booked in other peoples names, so when my friend misplaced her key and tried to get another she couldn't since the room was in some stranger's name!!! I even saw other guest say they walked into their room, and other peoples belongs were already there. What a mess!! 3 weeks later I am still trying to get my money back (over charged $183) and you can't contact the manager beause he is never available! Oh, and you can't contact the corporate to do anything because they are independently owned they direct you to the incompentent FRONT HOTEL STAFF that are completely worthless!!! I had contacted the Better Business Bureau!!! I will be back to MEMPHIS, but will never stay here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “UNPROFESSIONAL/UNSANITARY/UNORGANIZED/ DO GO”
Reviews.Author: livelife822
Reviews.Content: HAIR wasleft in blankets, toilets dont flush properly, staff is very rude at the front desk, housekeeping smokes while working,rooms smells like smoke mix with spoil garbage , headboards fall off the wall,tub was dirty. this hotel needs to start over with new people and renovate the entire hotel.Great location but wrong place to stay in keep it moving people if you dont want to get eaten by bugs un the bed.Elevator is slow.very scary parking lot, too dark, no lights on upper floors. never again will i stay there on this earth again. The pool was filthy.

Reviews.Title: “Gets the job done.”
Reviews.Author: TealBronco
Reviews.Content: This hotel will do if you are not looking for anything fancy or even remotely nice. If you are looking for a convenient location and are not concerned with the way the place looks, this hotel would be a good choice. The staff was very friendly and helpful (with the exception of the parking garage attendant who seemed to run away as we approached him with a question). We were traveling on a spring break road trip and wanted an easy and cheap overnight location in Memphis. The hallways and carpets were not particularly clean and did not feel safe, although we had no problems with safety while we were there. Our room was old and outdated but the sheets were not stained and the bathroom seemed to be clean.The room had exposed pipes which reminded us of the basement in the crappiest dorm on campus. One of the major concerns I had was that our hotel room window overlooked what seemed to be an abandoned warehouse. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for a female traveling alone. Had I not been with 3 other friends, it is likely that I would not have been able to sleep comfortably. The walls are thin and I could hear what was going on in all the rooms around me. For a group of college students on a tight budget, the hotel worked fine. Had I been by myself or with my family, I doubt we would have spent the night.

Reviews.Title: “C+”
Reviews.Author: gnik1414
Reviews.Content: My first impression was not good, the elevator was extremely slow! 5-10 minute wait for only 10 floors is terrible. The hallways looked like a tornado just went through with towels,sheets and all the doors open, including ours. We thought we were walking into someone room. The housekeeping was non existent for the 2 days we were there and the breakfast was way to sparse. The real and only amenity is the closeness to downtown. Blues City cafe for ribs, and Miss Pollys for some soul food made the hotel a much less concern.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Guitarman_53
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights so that we could visit both Beale street and Graceland. The drive to Graceland is fairly short and simple and the walk to Beale street is convenient. When we arrived the staff was friendly and helpful. We were early but they got us into a room right away. The walk to Beale street is a straight shot down 3rd street to the the corner where you will find the Rum Boogie Cafe. (good music) Many downtown bars have happy hour until 7:00 P.M. when the music starts. The room was acceptable but dirty. I had read this before we took the trip and they were right. I don't think the sheets are ever cleaned? They actually felt dirty and gritty. My wife said the room had a smell. The floor by the sink was damp and the hot/cold faucets were backwards. We never felt unsafe while walking to Beale street but we were asked for a handout by someone who approached as if he were concerned about our having a good time in the city. There was security person visible at the corner about a block before our hotel. If you want to hear good jazz music, the lounge across from the office had an excellent 4 piece band and the beers were about $3. You may need to show your room key to get in. The people in the longe were very friendly and the service was good. All in all, you get what you pay for, but, any other room we priced in this area was double the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price and friendly staff! But know security could be an issue.”
Reviews.Author: SteveinPhilly
Reviews.Content: Great location and price and friendly staff! But know security could be an issue. I was in Memphis for 5 nights at a conference at another hotel and shared a room with someone. When they had to depart a night early I searched from something reasonable in the area. I found this Econolodge and read the reviews. There seemed to have been an issue with noise but I had none during my stay. The room was basic but the King bed was REALLY comfortable. The hotel rooms are on the 7th through 10th floors over a parking garage. Checking in went fine with Deangela at the front desk. As I approached my room the housekeeping staff was very pleasant. I head some noise from the next room but it turned out to be the housekeeping person cleaning the bathroom. The walls are a bit thin but I had no problem. One think I liked was that the air/heat unit in the wall under the window was actually quiet when it ran. And it did not blow air directly at the bed as many hotel rooms do. I had a great nightâ€™s sleep. The hotel offers a free continental breakfast, which is served in the blues bar/night club next door. It consists of juice, coffee (but no REAL milk or cream.. just powdered â€œcreamerâ€�), HUGE bagels w/ cream cheese and REALLY large muffins. This was fine with me. Checkout with Lakita was also smooth. I was allowed to leave my bags there until my airport limo arrived in early afternoon. The hotel is in an area where there are few businesses and I wouldnâ€™t recommend that single women walk in the area AFTER dark, but I felt safe on the street. The one caveat which might give some concern is security. The room floors are accessed by an outside elevator that stops on the six parking lot floors. The desk clerk can see people entering the elevator but they may be busy with guests. And they wouldnâ€™t know if the person was going to a room or the parking lot floors. I guess I wasnâ€™t paranoid but I thought Iâ€™d point this out. It is easy walk to Beale Street, Main Street etc and the rate was at least 40% less than other hotels in the area. If I go back I would probably stay there again if I needed a fairly priced room in Memphis, a city with LOTS of empty hotels and yet â€“ for some reason â€“ high hotel rates.

Reviews.Title: “Stop don't do it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bmiss
Reviews.Content: Just left the place now, stayed 5 minutes and left in fear of both my safety and health. The place should be shut down. From a person who regularly stays in hostels in both Europe and the USA, this is by far the worst place I have ever been. All the bed linen was filthy with pubic hairs and stains of various natures (let's say bodily fluid) covering it. The floor was disgusting, the bathroom was unclean with faeces stains. The room was suposedly non smoking but stank of cigarettes and the door to the adjoining room had only what I can describe as a bathroom lock on it separating me from whoever was next door. I can only imagine that this hellhole is used for pay by the hour clientele, no sane person would stay here. I would not recommend it to my worst enemy. We have booked into the Marriott suites, beautiful! : )

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Fair quality.”
Reviews.Author: thingamajig
Reviews.Content: I needed to book a hotel quickly and economically in Memphis in the new year. I checked TripAdvisor as you should and though there was mixed reviews I thought the good outweighed the bad. The hotel is quite basic, I thought the front desk staff were nice enough without being over nice. The lift is a little scary ok. As far as I could determine everyone was booked on the 8th floor. I thought the room was old fashioned but comfortable and clean. The AC was old but effective if a little noisy. The bed was quite comfortable and I slept well for the four nights I stayed. The breakfast is a joke. You have to cross an entrance to a car park to a bar across the way, and you help yourself to bagels and muffins on paper plates and coffee in polystyrene cups , theres no cream or milk just powdered creamer. Saying that I thought the bagels were ok. However the location is excellent just a few minutes walk from Beale Street etc. and easy access to Memphis. Overall I'd say you get what you pay for. 2 star I didn't get a funky smell in the room or anything though. The music at night in the bar across the way (Breakfast bar?) is excellent also, there was a jazz quartet playing there on the Wednesday and they were marvelous.

Reviews.Title: “TOTALLY UNDER RATED!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler0428
Reviews.Content: We had four family's stay at the Econolodge Downtown last weekend. The hotel, staff, price and location were all WONDERFUL. My husband and I travel at least twice a month and have stayed at alot of different hotels. I have to say this was the nicest one yet!!! If you are looking for a 4 star hotel, no this is not for you!!! However, it is TOP NOTCH for it's two star rating!! We will most definitley stay here again when in Memphis.

Reviews.Title: “If you just want a place to sleep,”
Reviews.Author: terry_legal
Reviews.Content: Has an excellent location, and that's it.Owner should be ashamed.Clean your place up,elevator was very scary.There was a pill on the floor right beside the bed and after four nights it was still there.Found dead bugs,don't know what they were.Its too bad because it has such a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: TheScubaDuo
Reviews.Content: Excellent location right in the heart of Memphis - 5 minutes from Beale Street and Peabody hotel. Large room with king size bed and large bathroom. Pool was clean but did not use as only there for 1 night. Easy check-in and parking is below the hotel on floors 1-7 then hotel rooms above - $10 to park. Excellent welcome and check in. Price $73 plus tax - again excellent value compared to hotels in the area

Reviews.Title: “cheap and chearful”
Reviews.Author: cHuTnEyFeRrEtS
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff on reception. Room had a strange smell and is in need of a refubishment. Low budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money (even though inexpensive)”
Reviews.Author: everyoneloveslaura
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in September on a one day trip of the city. I booked based on cost and location. Total for the room with parking cost $95. The location is great - only 4 block walk to Beale Street, but it was not the best property to stay at. It was a bit smelly, very old, not that clean (I do think I got bit by bedbugs here too). I would recommend one of the other properties in town - splurge a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Best room for the money in Downtown Memphis”
Reviews.Author: sndsoulellis
Reviews.Content: I travel for a living and stay in hotels in the $50 to $100 range 3 times a week so this isnt a review by someone who only has hotel stays a few times a year. This was a quick weekend trip with my wife and i was surprised / relieved by this hotel after reading the other reviews. 1) Parking was convenient and cheap for location. $10 2) Check in and out were quick,easy, and room was correct. ( king bed ) 3) Elevators as previously mentioned by other reviewers were hot,small, and slow but I was only in the elevator for about two minutes a day so no big deal there. 4) The room was large and clean, bed was comfortable, had two comfortable chairs, tv and air conditioner both had operational wireless remotes...nice touch on the a/c 5) The furniture and bedding while not new were still in very good condition and not dirty 6) Any other hotel in this ssame area would cost at least twice as much. I have stayed at 3 previously. Easy walk to all downtown locations. I am not by any means an avid walker. The downside...( nothing to serious but i know some people are picky) : All rooms are marked non smoking but my room (smoking by request) had an ashtray and upon calling the front desk was told that it was a smoking room. There was a 2" pipe running across the top of the room on one wall but it was painted to match the wall and caused me no harm. The breakfast situation seemed a little questionable so I didnt even go check it out plus there was a coffee pot in the room. The bathroom was small and the water pressure wasnt that great but then again that was not a big part of my trip. '

Reviews.Title: “Yuck--dirty, smokey--very old bedding--will not do again.”
Reviews.Author: Carolina101
Reviews.Content: I was looking to save money while visiting my son in college. I checked in and was hit in the face with smoke smell--even though the hotel was supposed to be entirely nonsmoking. The air freshiner they used to try to "clean" the air only made things worse. The room REEKED of smoke and strawberries. Bathroom was old, bedding was gross. Area of town is questionalble. Not a safe walk to Beale Street. It is too far and too dark. Is is worth extra money to stay elsewhere. Staff was nice and let me leave cancelling my reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Beale Street but tired and need of a refit. AVOID breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Tappy Feet
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on 3 floors - 8, 9 and 10 - above a multi storey carpark. The pool is on the 8th floor. We had a room overlooking the pool on the 8th floor. The pool wasn't too clean and only had 4 sunbeds. The room was large and reasonably clean but although it was a no smoking room, it always had a smoke odour. The car park has an attendant on duty at all times so if felt safe walking back in the evening. Breakfast YEUK. It was held in a basement lounge acrss the carpark. Bagels, muffins and drinks that was all. All located in a stinkey, smokey bar. There was one knife for everyone to use and 1 pak of cream chesse for everyone. I asked for a knofe to spead butter and the attendant told me to use the spoon. Coffee tasted foul. I tried to make a call from the room but the operator told me all calls were blocked. Why give you a phone in the room? Parking costs an additional $10 a day. There was a ball game on whilst we were there so we walked there and back. A pleasant night out. Best thing about the hotel - location. We won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs and Head Lice”
Reviews.Author: dustty09
Reviews.Content: This place is FILTHY/SCARY and the service is horrible. First night there we had someone try to get in our room at 3am. Next night there we had someone try to get in through the adjoining room door. Third night there my legs were bitten so badly while sleeping that they swelled. Just returned from the doctor who told me that the bites on my legs and feet were indeed bed bug bites. Just one day after our return, my friend has found that she has head lice. Did I mention the hookers in the parking garage? The dirty sheets and towels? The smell of urine in the halls? The horrible staff? DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here, Unclean, My daughter got Head Lice from the beds!!!”
Reviews.Author: misse25
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this location last weekend and it was HORRIBLE!! The carpets are filthy with stains all over them, there were bugs crawling out of the ceiling cracks in the bathroom, and the safety lock on the door was broken off and had never been replaced. And to top off the horrible visit my daughter got head lice from staying here and sleeping in the bed. This hotel staff obviously doesn't clean or change sheets or we wouldn't have this problem. This is the worst place I have ever stayed and needs some serious cleaning done to it, it's just nasty in the rooms and definately not worth the money I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare At Econo Lodge”
Reviews.Author: BeckyK1024
Reviews.Content: Family vacation started out great until we arrived at hotel....Checking in we were informed that there was a $10.00 a night to park, when we reserved the room our reservation was with free parking and breakfast, which was argued by the front desk and she had a very bad attitude, not courteous at all. So we let that slide since we had no choice. The room was not what we expected after looking at the pictures online,the beds weren't even full size maybe 3/4, sheets on one bed had stains,had to change sheets. The bathroom was so small and outdated you couldn't turn around in and no exhaust fan, no water pressure at all and the bathtub was stopped up so if you took a shower you had water up past your ankles. Couldn't get towels or washcloths when we asked, had to call down for coffee packs. And as for the pool we were there for 3 days and didn't even get in the pool, it was GREEN, not the pretty blue as in the picture,evidentally it hadn't seen any clorine in a while,it was just nasty looking, in fact the day we left they had the pool drained (could it have been a dissatisfied customer)? The free breakfast was in the bar/ lounge area which I didn't appreciate taking my granddaughter in and things weren't refilled. As for the exercise room, don't have a clue what it was like, we couldn't even get in...lol.The elevators were scary, you were always hoping it wouldn't stop on you, no air in and very small. And I would watch the front desk if you're calling a taxi, they may have a money maker there......the front desk told us after she called us one it would be around $5 to get 2 blocks to Beale St.,when he let us off the taxi ride was $15 (WHATTTTT!!!!) But, just like the parking fee what are you going to do. We will never stay at this hotel again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Beale but not the best place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Aerowing
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on a Friday. The outside of the hotel looked like a big parking garage. Check in was inside the entrance of the garage and lobby is tiny. Parking is an extra $10.00. I had a non smoking room on the 10th floor. Elevators are very slow. My room, a superior king looked dated. The window in the room had that bathroom type, no peek in stuff on it....huh? The curtain was floor length and had some missing hardware. The chair in the room was stained. Bed was fine as were bedding and pillows. Sink was outside bathroom and the coffee pot was missing. Water pressure was fine in the shower. The hotel claimed it had free wi-fi but it didnt seem to work for me. There's also a pool in a courtyard on the 6th or 7th floor and looked ok. The hotel also includes a free continental breakfast which was a joke. You have to go into the lounge nextdoor and down to the lower area to get it. It consisted of a couple hard bagles, muffins and doughnuts, plus orange juice and coffee. Employees were eating with the paying customers and never refilled the juice or the breads. The hotel is in a good location to Beale street (about 4 blocks south) and all the attractions and nightlife. The hotel was ok for my one night and if your looking for something under $100.00 and close to Beale then this might be for you. If I ever need to stay downtown on a budget then I would say check this place out. I would probably stay here again if I ever needed to come back to Memphis.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, and three blocks from Beale Street”
Reviews.Author: PackaBagJohn
Reviews.Content: It's an Econo Lodge and cost $64 a night for a King. The room was clean and very roomy. no fridge or microwave. Parking was $10/day, but in a downtown hotel that is normal and reasonable. Staff was good when checking in and out. Continental breakfast in attached lounge on ground floor was decent muffins and danish. Plan on using it again if I cone back to memphis soon. Sister-in-law said pool was very nice, I forgot suit.

Reviews.Title: “LOUSY AND VERY POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: travelaficionado2
Reviews.Content: We tried to reserve a night stay with them, but I misheard the rate per night so when I told rep not to go through with reservation, she said (her name is Charlotte according to her) she will charge us with cancellation fee nonetheless. She hasn't given me any confirmation number or anything so I asked to speak with the manager. But she said, "the manager is not on site." Another rep helped her by threatening my husband and telling him repeatedly, "I can do it. I can" as if saying you can't do anything about it. I WILL NOT GO OR DEAL WITH ANY ECONO LODGE for fear that if ther customer reps can treat their potential customers like that over the phone, then their service will not be any better in person. THEY WERE NOT WILLING TO LISTEN AND HANDLE ISSUE APPROPRIATELY!

Reviews.Title: “Just mediocre”
Reviews.Author: cancungirl21
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I had never been on a road trip together. We decided to do something within driving distance from home. She had her mind made up to stay at another hotel that was not as close to downtown. In some ways, I wish we would have. The only reason I was glad she changed it, it was close to Beale Street! The pictures online are NOTHING like the rooms. The pictures show green bushes in front and there are flowers there now so this tells me that the pics are when the hotel was much newer and nicer. She noticed there were four lounge chairs in the pictures online so she called and asked if there were more LOUNGE chairs and they said yes. Well, that was a lie because there are FOUR and one was broken. She called back after making the reservation to ask for a refrigerator and microwave and they told her she could do that at check in; we arrived to check in and she asked for the fridge and microwave or if our room had it and the girl said I will have to see if we have one. She never gave us an answer as to whether she did or not. We got to our room to find the carpet ancient and looked like it was shredding and had been stretched a million times.very dark blue and nasty. The beds were not as they were described or looked in the online pics but not too bad in the way of comfort. We noticed rooms with the doors open when being cleaned and they were a lot nicer than ours. They did not have a lot of people staying there so why they chose to give us the crappiest room, I will never know. The cleaning people are very noisy in the hallway talking loud amongst themselves and take a long time to complete the rooms on the floor. Most cleaning people I have seen are quiet, clean the rooms and figure they can go home when they are finished. These people must get paid by the hour because they are so busy talking, they are there until four in the afternoon. We did a hear TV up full blast early one morning and people at the pool at times. The filters in the pool were not on and my friend cleaned it herself. There was hair and crap in the pool and no one ever came out to clean the actual pool itself. There was a guy coming around sweeping and checking the pool deck but not the pool. We never saw anyone put chemicals in and it didn't smell like they had any chlorine in it. The pluses are the hotel is close to Beale, some of the staff are very friendly, the price is great, there is a parking attendant but two nights out of three, the guy was literally asleep in the booth! That would have made a great pic-Kodak moment.lol If you don't mind an old hotel and you are just looking for an economical way to go to Memphis, this would be fine. The breakfast they talk about is bagels and danishes with juice according to what we were told by the front desk. There is NO cereal. We asked. Also, there is an iron and ironing board in the room. If you want a hair dryer, you have to ask at the front desk and they do have them.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and value”
Reviews.Author: SC1R
Reviews.Content: Does not look like much, but its right there and has nice room for the price. Room was clean. Desk Staff was distracted with petty arguments at checkout. Check in was fine. Only blocks from Beale street. TV was old.

Reviews.Title: “Modest but worth it”
Reviews.Author: ACBlues
Reviews.Content: We stayed here due to the cost and proximity to Beale Street. This place is not the Ritz, but the room was comfortable and clean, the staff was friendly and it's an easy walk to Beale, Peabody, the ball park, etc. Our only minor complaint was the shower--the head is placed really low on the wall and my 6'2 husband had to crouch down to use the shower. I would definately stay again and recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “music to my ears not related to hotel”
Reviews.Author: carpediem4e
Reviews.Content: The Econo Lodge is 2 blocks from all major attractions and compared to surrounding hotels half the price. Check in was a little long and we had to pay for parking $10. The room was clean internet worked and people were over all friendly. There is music from every where the bar next door, the street and even the parking garage it self. If your a music lover you will like it if your looking for quiet, stay at the expensive hotel down the street. The elevators are a lil scary. They make noise that will make you believe in a higher power or at least hope there is one. they are also the same temp as outside, whatever that is at the moment. The Nelly's restaurant is down the street which is no big thrill but the BBQ is good. Check out Kings Palace and tip my man at the door good!

HotelInfo.Name: Econo Lodge Downtown Memphis
HotelInfo.Address: 22 North Third Street, Memphis, TN 38103
